page.title: 09LODGE FARM AND RECTORY FARM
page.content: LODGE FARM 148 acres. This farm is Council rented. The farmer works on his own though has some casual labour. The farmhouse is let by the Council as the farmer lives in Fulbourn. Among his machines is a split-mould reversible plough used on hard soil, ploughing to a depth of 5-6" . A Dutch harrow with straight tines harrows top soil and consolidates, to avoid erosion and retain moisture. RECTORY FARM 401 acres. Size of field varies from 16-40 acres. Farm owned by the farmer, inherited from his father. His spacious brick-built house erected in 1981. Two farm labourers live in the cottages at the end of the farm drive. An average price for feed wheat is Â£100 per ton, Â£110 for bread making wheat. Yields are improving due to more disease-free strains of seed.
